item.description:
Join us for an information-sharing (and hopefully inspirational) session about neighborhood tool libraries.  Ever wonder why we all need to own all the same tools?  Or realize that we all don't need to own the same tools?  Tool libraries have been popping up and operating successfully in several other cities around North America and we're hoping to bring the idea to the communities of Southern Maine.

Portland Location TBD based on RSVP levels.

In this session we will:

Hear from member Anna Sommo about the tool library in which she participated in Portland OR

Gain and understanding of the way tool libraries operate and get started

Talk about whether there is enough energy to get a 'pilot project' off the ground with a tool library in one of Portland's neighborhoods (but anyone who's fired up should go for it in their own community, of course!).

  • 6:30 Welcome & Intro (who's there, from where)
  • 6:45 What is a tool library, examples from other places
  • 7:00 How to start one
  • 7:15-7:45 Brainstorm how to move forward here....
  • 7:45-8:00 Next steps, staying in touch, action items, if applicable.

group.name: Portland Maine Permaculture & The Resilience Hub

item.name: Neighborhood Tool Library Info Session
